bio.summary:
A multilingual front-end coder, I speak English, CSS, HTML, French, Drupal, all cleanly and semantically of course. Common sense usually prevails throughout, provided a good supply of tea.

Past projects include: Chatham House, Data.Gov.UK, BBC Good Food, ITV Player, Bristol City Council.

Working with Drupal for 5 years as a themer. I attended 8 Drupalcamps in 2012 and spoke at 3 about how to stop designing pages and effective on-boarding processes.

Likes: Open Source, fruit, styleguides, agile and kanban, Git, SASS, Drupal theming, pattern libraries, Github, nonprofits, collaboration, structure and tea.

Dislikes: static web page design PSDs, messy markup, multi-national corporations, projects without version control, without documentation, without project management, coffee, not being able to learn new things.

Frontend United London 2013 co-organiser, a not-for-profit european conference delivering inspiring talks.

Main role consisted of preparing Wireframes and Information Architecture, setting up Drupal websites and implementing theme design, as well as support agent for clients and all static, CMSMadeSimple and Drupal websites. Other functions included managing/installing Debian servers, educating designers on design for the web, training clients on CMS.
Cogworks used an in-house ASP.NET CMS, this required implementing design from PSD into a static HTML/CSS model that was then templated for the CMS.

The redesign of greenbee.com required a tighter design harmony with the quote system calling the various Insurance Company APIs, while taking into account the consequent limited flexibility. Updates were also required for the various insurance cover booklets to be provided to customers.

T5M run a video magazine website, at the time they were working closely with Microsoft, where I would build the various designs to pass on to the developers, this included the use of newly released MS Expression Studio. While the company was still small, I was also IT support and print designer. As the company grew, I specialised in building the corporate site and numerous HTML/CSS snippets to be implemented in the application.

references.name: James Borrodell Brown
references.reference: Tom really helped us out on a number of occasions by being available at odd hours (including, I think, at midnight on one very stressful Sunday) and we really enjoyed having his friendly face on the team. Good luck Tom hope we can catch up soon!

references.name: private private
references.reference: Tom worked on the Drupal theming for a local government site. This had very high requirements in pixel-level precision, browser compatibility, and accessibility. This meant that a very high level of expertise was required and Tom demonstrated that he could consistently deliver. He was highly regarded by colleagues on the delivery team as well as those managing the engagement. I would have no hesitation in hiring Tom again for a Drupal theming role.

references.name: Simon Elliott
references.reference:
We engaged Tom to work with us as a themer on a major Drupal project for an international client of the French Capgemini Drupal Factory. 
Tom put in the long hours required to meet the short deadlines, he proved a valuable resource to the team.
The site has since been rolled out in Taiwan and Belgium, and localised versions are soon to be rolled out across the rest of Europe and the Far East.

references.name: Tabitha Winter
references.reference:
Tom is an extremely valuable addition to any Drupal team. He works well with others and understands the various issues inherent in the delivery of software. His theming knowledge is beyond compare and due to his deeply embedded status within the Drupal community is a fountain of knowledge, able to bounce ideas around with project managers, product owners and back end developers alike, to come up with the best solution for the task at hand.

I would definitely recommend Tom and would work with him again if the opportunity arose.

references.name: Justin Anderson
references.reference: Tom is an enthusiastic and keen web developer who constantly researches and experiments with new technologies and web tools. He has a good design eye and an intelligent approach to web development.

references.name: private private
references.reference:
I had the pleasure of briefly working alongside Tom while we completed the Bristol City Council website. He was tasked with ensuring the site's HTML and CSS was in accordance with the WCAG 2.0 guidelines and a specialist accessibility agency's regular reviews. 

He undertook this challenging task and made it appear effortless. I would not hesitate to recommend or work with Tom again.

references.name: Chris Maiden
references.reference: Tom is a conscientious and dedicated Drupal themer. I would have no trouble in recommending him!
